Generates a selection number from the group number for each filament.

Reselects particles identified by an input STAR tag and between a minimum and maximum.

A function to select particles based on comparison of the orientations within a series.

Selects groups of particles based on the FOM.

Selects a percentage of particles based on the FOM.

Selects the best particles based on the FOM.

Selects particles based on FOM average and standard deviation.

Selects a specific number of particles randomly.

Selects particles randomly based on a fraction of the total.

Selects groups randomly to give at least a number of particles.

Generates a selection number from the group number for each filament.

Selects a given number of particles randomly with replacement.

Selects particles based on a smoothed maximum surface.

Selects the best number of particles within each view.

Transfer selection numbers to the group identifiers.

section.title: part_filament_direction()[1/2]

para.computeroutput: long part_filament_direction (Bproject * project, Bproject * project2, double minpct)

para.para: Checks the direction of particles associated with filaments and compares with opposite filament direction.

entry.para: second project structure with opposite filamant directions.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles with clear direction. The selected particles associated with a filament is checked for their in-plane direction. If the percentage of particles exceed the minimum desired, the particles with the corresponding direction are selected, and the rest deselected.

If the percentage of particles exceed the minimum desired, the particles with the corresponding direction are selected, and the rest deselected.

section.para: Definition at line 3143 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_fom_defocus_fit()

para.computeroutput: double part_fom_defocus_fit (Bproject * project, int fom_index, double & intercept, double & slope)

para.para: Fits the particle FOMs as a function of the defocus.

entry.para: index of FOM value to test for.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double correlation index of fit. The FOM is fit as a linear function of the defocus average.

section.para: Definition at line 2923 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_fom_defocus_fit_deselect()

para.computeroutput: double part_fom_defocus_fit_deselect (Bproject * project, int fom_index, double cutoff)

para.para: Deselects particles below a given FOM cutoff, adjusted for the defocus.

entry.para: index of FOM value to test for.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: double correlation index of fit. The FOM is fit as a linear function of the defocus average. Particles are deselected based on the adjusted FOM cutoff: adj_cut = slope * defocus + cut

angular step size around primary symmetry axis (radians).

section.para: Definition at line 1729 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_bootstrap()

para.para: Selects a given number of particles randomly with replacement.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. A random number between 1 and the number of selected particles is generated the given number of times. The selection value for the selected particle is incremented each time. A particle may therefore be selected more than once.

section.para: Definition at line 1453 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_closest_to_focus()

para.para: Deselects all particles except those from micrographs closest to focus.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected.

section.para: Definition at line 3008 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_FOM_avg_std()

para.computeroutput: long part_select_FOM_avg_std (Bproject * project, double factor, int fom_index)

para.para: Selects particles based on FOM average and standard deviation.

entry.para: factor to multiply standard deviation with.
which FOM value to select on.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. Particles are selected using the average and standard deviation, with the level set as a function of difference from the average: selected > average + factor*std_dev Note the multiplying factor can be negative. Only particles already selected are subject to the test.

section.para: Definition at line 1108 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_FOM_groups()

para.computeroutput: long part_select_FOM_groups (Bproject * project, int ngroups, int fom_index, int defocus_fit)

para.para: Selects groups of particles based on the FOM.

entry.para: index of FOM value to select on.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected in the first group. Particles are ranked according to the figure-of-merit and equal numbers are distributed to the requested number of particle groups. The particle group selections are then written into a selection array in the STAR data base, with the group with the best FOM's first. Only particles already selected are subject to the test.

section.para: Definition at line 945 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_frames()

para.computeroutput: long part_select_frames (Bproject * project, int frame_start, int frame_end)

para.para: Select particles from frames in a series.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. Particles in frames from a series in the same field-of-view are selected. Only particles that are already selected are considered.

section.title: part_select_random()

para.para: Selects a specific number of particles randomly.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. An array is set up for all selected particles. The given number of random elements is selected in the array and transfered as particle selections.

section.title: part_select_random_fraction()

para.para: Selects particles randomly based on a fraction of the total.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. A random number between 0 and 1 is generated for each particle and if it is smaller than the given fraction, the particle is selected.

section.para: Definition at line 1243 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_random_group()

para.para: Selects groups randomly to give at least a number of particles.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. A random number between 0 and 1 is generated for each particle and if it is smaller than the given fraction, the particle is selected.

section.para: Definition at line 1292 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_random_within_view()

para.computeroutput: long part_select_random_within_view (Bproject * project, Bsymmetry & sym, double theta_step, double phi_step, int number)

para.para: Selects a given number of particles within each view.

entry.para: angular step size from primary symmetry axis (radians).
angular step size around primary symmetry axis (radians).

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. A random number between 1 and the number of selected particles is generated the given number of times. The selection value for the selected particle is incremented each time. A particle may therefore be selected more than once. This selection is meant to be used with the bootstrap reconstruction.

section.para: Definition at line 1512 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_select_series()

para.computeroutput: long part_select_series (Bproject * project, int size, int flag)

para.para: Select series where all are already selected.

entry.para: number of particles in each set.
flag to not count across mg or rec boundaries.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles selected. This function selects those series where all the particles are already selected, and deselects the rest. Sets are selected with each series part of the same set.

section.para: Definition at line 2760 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

para.para: Selects sets of particles, each set with the same size.

entry.para: number of particles in each set.
flag to not count across mg or rec boundaries.

formalpara.title: Returns

section.para: Definition at line 829 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_series_from_seed()

para.para: Calculates the locations of particles in a series from a seed.

entry.para: bit 1=invert z, bit 2=use original particle view.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: long number of particles created. The seed particle locations is either in the zero-degree tilt 2D micrograph, or a 3D reconstruction. The latter also gives the z-coordinate, resulting in a better definition of the particle location. The project selection flag indicates micrograph or reconstruction.

section.para: Definition at line 2819 of file mg_particle_select.cpp.

section.title: part_set_best_view_in_series()

para.para: Sets all orientation parameters for a particle to the best in the set.

entry.para: index of FOM value to select on.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: int 0. This function uses the FOM to select the best orientation parameters for a particle in a set (typically a focal series) and sets all orientation parameters to the same values.
